description: The Montgomery Independent School District's Board of Trustees has selected an interim superintendent. The board unanimously approved hiring Ann Dixon to lead the school district temporarily as the school board searches for a candidate to replace its outgoing superintendent, Beau Rees, during a special meeting held on May 21.  "Ann brings extensive...
text:
The Montgomery Independent School District's Board of Trustees has selected an
interim superintendent.

The board unanimously approved hiring Ann Dixon to lead the school district
temporarily as the school board searches for a candidate to replace its
outgoing superintendent, Beau Rees, during a special meeting held on May 21.

CORONAVIRUS: Food market will help 300 Montgomery County families get meals on
Saturday

"Ann brings extensive experience as an interim superintendent with over 20
previous assignments," Montgomery ISD School Board President Jim Dossey stated
in a social media post. "The board was very impressed by Ann's financial
knowledge and acumen. We believe that Ann is the right candidate to help set
the next permanent superintendent up for success."

Rees, who has served as Montgomery ISD's superintendent since 2011, is
expected to start his position as the new superintendent of Weatherford
Independent School District on June 1. He was announced as a finalist in
April. This month, Montgomery ISD's school board hired the search firm,
Thompson & Horton LLP, to help find a top professional with a "fairly
aggressive timeline" to serve as the new superintendent by August.

In the meantime, Dixon will begin her new position as the interim
superintendent for Montgomery ISD on June 1.

JOBS: Exxon Mobile says no layoffs planned at this time

According to information from the school district, Dixon started her career as
a speech pathologist in Austin. She previously served Judson ISD for 18 years
following her work at Copperas Cove and North East Independent School
Districts. She then became the superintendent of Somerset ISD in 1990.

"In addition to working in school districts, Dr. Dixon also has experience at
the state level," Montgomery ISD stated in a release. "Dr. Dixon has worked
with the Texas Comptroller's and the Texas Legislative Budget Board, as well
as serving for many first-time superintendents."

"For her distinguished service to her profession and community, the 76th Texas
Legislature recognized her with a resolution of commendation," the information
stated.

FEDERAL FUNDS: Montgomery County commissioner balks at truck purchase with
federal funds, ante ups precinct fleet vehicle

According to the school district, Dixon has been published numerous times in
the Texas Study Research Journal as well as the Texas Elementary Principals
and Supervisors Association Journal. The release stated she has been called
"as an expert witness" in education litigation and consults with school
districts who are conducting superintendent searches and has served as the
interim in district around the state 20 times.

She holds a Doctor of Philosophy in Administration from Walden University, a
Master of Arts in Elementary and Early Childhood Education from the University
of Texas San Antonio and a Bachelor of Science in Speech and Hearing Pathology
from Oklahoma State University.

[mellsworth@hcnonline.com](mailto:mellsworth@hcnonline.com)

title: Montgomery ISD tabs Dixon as interim superintendent
html:
The Montgomery Independent School District's Board of Trustees has selected an interim superintendent.

The board unanimously approved hiring Ann Dixon to lead the school district temporarily as the school board searches for a candidate to replace its outgoing superintendent, Beau Rees, during a special meeting held on May 21.

CORONAVIRUS: Food market will help 300 Montgomery County families get meals on Saturday

"Ann brings extensive experience as an interim superintendent with over 20 previous assignments," Montgomery ISD School Board President Jim Dossey stated in a social media post. "The board was very impressed by Ann's financial knowledge and acumen. We believe that Ann is the right candidate to help set the next permanent superintendent up for success."

Rees, who has served as Montgomery ISD's superintendent since 2011, is expected to start his position as the new superintendent of Weatherford Independent School District on June 1. He was announced as a finalist in April. This month, Montgomery ISD's school board hired the search firm, Thompson & Horton LLP, to help find a top professional with a "fairly aggressive timeline" to serve as the new superintendent by August.

In the meantime, Dixon will begin her new position as the interim superintendent for Montgomery ISD on June 1.

JOBS: Exxon Mobile says no layoffs planned at this time

According to information from the school district, Dixon started her career as a speech pathologist in Austin. She previously served Judson ISD for 18 years following her work at Copperas Cove and North East Independent School Districts. She then became the superintendent of Somerset ISD in 1990.

"In addition to working in school districts, Dr. Dixon also has experience at the state level," Montgomery ISD stated in a release. "Dr. Dixon has worked with the Texas Comptroller's and the Texas Legislative Budget Board, as well as serving for many first-time superintendents."

"For her distinguished service to her profession and community, the 76th Texas Legislature recognized her with a resolution of commendation," the information stated.

FEDERAL FUNDS: Montgomery County commissioner balks at truck purchase with federal funds, ante ups precinct fleet vehicle

According to the school district, Dixon has been published numerous times in the Texas Study Research Journal as well as the Texas Elementary Principals and Supervisors Association Journal. The release stated she has been called "as an expert witness" in education litigation and consults with school districts who are conducting superintendent searches and has served as the interim in district around the state 20 times.

She holds a Doctor of Philosophy in Administration from Walden University, a Master of Arts in Elementary and Early Childhood Education from the University of Texas San Antonio and a Bachelor of Science in Speech and Hearing Pathology from Oklahoma State University.
